Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Robert Imerson "IRob"
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have owned many digital cameras and find this the best one we have ever owned. Apparently it's a new generation. It is so automatic it makes it really easy to use. It automatically detects the photo type you are taking and lets you know - scenery, cuisine, closeup, etc. The smile feature is fun. Face detection with exposure correction really works. It's compact, boots up quickly and has little or no delay when taking a picture. The 12MB picture really captures detail. We love this camera but may buy another brand for my wife when the time comes just because I like to experiment.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: I have two other Sony Cyber-shot cameras that I am very happy with so when I needed an extra pocket-sized camera, it was a simple decision.  I really like the larger screen on this camera and the simplicity of the settings means less fussing and more point & shoot.  In fact, I found myself grabbing this camera more than my old Cyber-shot which has more features.I only had one issue in three weeks of frequent use.  There was a more noticeable delay sometimes when taking pictures and some pictures came out blurry.  This mostly occurred when I was taking photographs of stationary aircraft outside in full sunlight so I am not sure why it had difficulty finding the focal point.  I would retake the picture seconds later and it would focus just fine.  Our conclusion was that it might have been a low battery issue since we had to replace the batteries the next day.  However, the low battery indicator did not come on during these issues.

Reviews.Title: Good price for a sleek one
Reviews.Author: Partha
Reviews.Content: This is a must have if you are a no-hassle camera lover. This is a no frill camera and gives you just what it promises. was impressed with the quick response .. takes a second to save a snap and get ready for the next click ..!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent: All around
Reviews.Author: OJ Silk
Reviews.Content: It irks me that people write negative reviews and mislead others simply because they like to complain -- when in fact -- they don't know what they're talking about. This camera does indeed have an internal speaker, therefore your video will certainly have sound. Yes, it does not include an SD card -- news flash -- cameras generally don't include them so you can go out and buy the size you want. The camera is great and very affordable. If you want a simple point and shoot camera for every day, compact use -- this camera is excellent. I repeat, very simple to use and excellent quality. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: Snapshot Warrior
Reviews.Author: Michael P. Daugherty "Doc"
Reviews.Content: It's a Sony...through and through.  Bought for my 14 year old son...4th digital camera I've bought in 10 years.  Good resolution...great cycle speed.  Sturdy construction.  Great "snapshot" camera...rugged to deal with a 14 year old beating!

Reviews.Title: Easy to use and good pics.
Reviews.Author: E. Ervin "eke14"
Reviews.Content: I had the DSC-P92 for year. The menus are nearly the same. The picture brightness varies with pixel choice though. No touchscreen or lithium batteries - less for me to break. Small enough and light enough. Not much zoom, but high pixels (~4.5MB file for 12MP).

Reviews.Title: Outstanding little PAT camera
Reviews.Author: Rodney Roof "Warlord"
Reviews.Content: I won't get into specifics but let me quickly state the Sony DSC-S2100 is great little camera at budget price. I compared it to my sisters Nikon L20 and was amazed at how much better the performance of the Sony was in comparsion to the Nikon. The build seems durable with metal shutter lens cover as opposed to plastic. I guess the one thing I wish it had is a lower f-stop. It will only do 3.1.I used this camera to expose Panasonics flawed black levels

Reviews.Title: Sony DSC-S2100
Reviews.Author: K. Chen
Reviews.Content: Exellent point and shoot compact digital camera with 3x optical zoom and image stabilizer which creates good picture qualitity for everyday use. Could be made a little smaller and prettier, but for the price just under $100, it is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Simple I guess
Reviews.Author: T. Swanson
Reviews.Content: Simple camera but tries to be very smart. Smile detection is great if your subject stops and poses for you. If you want a spontaneous shot, the settings have to be changed. Goes thru batteries pretty quick. Good camera for the price. Note: you must buy an extra storage card or the camera only takes a couple of pictures, 4G will give you a 1000+ pictures

Reviews.Title: Digital Camera for Dummies
Reviews.Author: G
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my mom who had never had a digital camera of her own - she was still using a 35mm with film....it is easy to use, small enough to take with you anywhere, and takes great pictures!  It's great!

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Mark Ellis
Reviews.Content: I don't have a lot of experience with digital cameras,  but I think this one is a winner. I borrowed an earlier model Sony last year that cost way more, and this is better. Nice little camera, good features, easy to use, and a great price.

Reviews.Title: Just what I was looking for
Reviews.Author: dumfounded
Reviews.Content: Digital cameras that use AA batteries are disappearing from the landscape, but I was fortunate to find this Sony DSC-S2100 camera that still uses the convenient, inexpensive batteries. I'm sure the lithium batteries are fine, but I like to have some extra batteries handy when shooting an event. The camera, like an earlier model Sony I have, is easy to use and well made, and I like the smaller size of the DSC-S2100. It will take movies as well, and the only thing I don't like about the camera is the location of the switch to select pictures or movies. I sometimes select the movie setting by accident when taking the camera out of its carrying case. I'm a fan of Sony quality, and this camera is not a power guzzler, so I'm still on my first set of batteries.

Reviews.Title: Good little camera
Reviews.Author: Dean Rodgers
Reviews.Content: Great so far 50-75 pics taken with batteries that it came with & still going, wish zoom was better, auto works great on what ever type of photo your taking haven't tried video yet, but its got to be better then the old camera i had. the best thing i like about it is its takes the sony card or an sd card & no rechargeable batteries just takes 2 aa batteries {for it was $49.99 for a new battery for my old 1, it lasted about 18 months} Adding to review{9/30/2010} 1 other thing this camera has a still video, you can't zoom in or out on this one, as my old one could zoom in a bit wan't a fixed video did't know that found out after having it a month.

Reviews.Title: Lightweight but not-very-good pictures
Reviews.Author: Pattipeg S. Harjo "Spanish teacher"
Reviews.Content: I love my Canon Powershot A-95, which takes really fabulous pictures, but it's also a little heavy for me to put in my backpack for Europe, so I found this at the local BX.  The good news: it's lightweight (6.5 oz with batteries) and slim, and will easily fit in a pocket.  It uses regular AA batteries--all the other light-weigh cameras only use rechargeable batteries, which means I would have to take along a (relatively)heavy recharger, thus defeating the purpose of buying the camera in the first place. Finally, it plugged right into my netbook and I uploaded pictures easily.On the downside, it only uses the Sony SD stick, and the pictures are soft. Not blurry (except when you zoom in on the picture), but certainly not crisp.  However, apparently all light-weight cameras have lousy picture quality, so it's a trade-off between weight and quality. Since my pictures will mostly appear on Facebook, I guess their being soft won't matter too much.If picture quality matters (e.g. you're going to make prints), you don't want this camera.  If you're going to use the pictures  on-line (blog or social-networking site), and weight is an issue, this is probably a good camera for you.  BTW get it at Amazon--I'd have saved $20 had I done so.

Reviews.Title: Expected more from sony
Reviews.Author: Alain de León
Reviews.Content: After using this camera for 6 months here is my review, bad bad very bad camera, it only takes good pictures if you are outside with plenty of sunlight otherwise pictures are just way too dark or to bright, i have to keep retouching my pics with photoshop to make them look good and also the pics are grainy, the camera is very sensible to motion the steady shot has only worked a couple of times and there is no way to force the steady shot to work, what i got a lot is the motion warning icon instead of the steady shot icon to help me reduce the motion i guess it depends on the mood of the camera, the auto focus works weird too if you are gonna take a close up you have to keep on trying a lot to make it work right, it focuses the objective and then it defocuses?????? after like 4 or 5 attempts it finally focus the objective the right way, and believe me i have tried all the possible settings with this camera.I use to have a canon powershot A70 just 3.2MP and it took far better pictures than the dcs-s2100 but after 5 years of heavy use it finally die so i decided to try a Cyber Shot since the old ones used too be awesome cameras but with this one my perception of the sony cameras have changed a lot.

Reviews.Title: a user-friendly camera
Reviews.Author: Fatih Cengiz
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this camera!. It is very user-friendly. If you do not have any expectation more than easily taking photo with high quality, this camera will be your best.

Reviews.Title: Best Point of Shot Camera I have Purchased
Reviews.Author: Qi Liu "krispos"
Reviews.Content: This is the fourth point of shot camera that I have purchased. I have tried Kodak, Canon and this sony little camera is the best in terms of size, easiness to use and picture quality.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Omnius "omniknowledge"
Reviews.Content: As a point and shoot, this camera is has everything that one would need. Its small, takes good enough pictures and has the ability to be adjusted as necessary for more custom shots then "point and shoot" This is my second Sony camera, and I am impressed with the advancements Sony has just made in a couple years. I shopped around looking at reviews, and after checking out what seems like a hundred reviews I am glad I just picked the Sony. Camera snobs who are looking for some magick camera that is a $2k Nikon for a couple hundred bucks or less should review their subject matter. Orange is good because it is easily visible too.

Reviews.Title: no internal speaker
Reviews.Author: CN
Reviews.Content: Note that the camera does NOT have internal speaker.  Kind of annoying that sony left this out.  Captures video but playback on the camera is muted.  Otherwise a good camera.  Smile shutter works nicely.

Reviews.Title: It's actually a 4.5
Reviews.Author: Sir Michael "cruising and musing"
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace my quickly expiring 2004 Cybershot 3.2 MP <TAPS please>. The price of this one is even lower than what I paid in 2004: plus I prefer the AA battery power feature: it makes replenishing the expired batteries that much more hassle-proof.Now that I have it, however, I see why the cost is lower than the $165.00 2004 price: no sound playback on the camera. Therefore, one doesn't get the benefit of testing volume levels. Hence, the -.5 on my rating. Otherwise it'd be a 5-star machine.The video playback on an HD pc is excellent: no graininess at all, smooth frame transitions (get a fast SD card: don't trip on a few dollars), excellent sound recording; it is very professional. The focus BEEP indicator is great when shooting; beep #1 on half-press lets one know they're in focus; press further and it's followed by another beep indicating one's press has triggered the shutter.The BONUS is what's built-into it; something never mentioned in the promos: 6 GB of native memory! KEEPER!!!! That compensates for the lack of sound playback.It was very easy to set-up. I'm very glad I got it.happy shopping!

Reviews.Title: Nice and very friendly camera
Reviews.Author: Naruto
Reviews.Content: This was purchased as a gift for my mother. I found it was a very-easy-to-use device and turns out it is indeed. My mother loved it. It takes beautifuls pics. The only think I didn't like is that even it records video, when you play it from the camera it does not have audio so you can't hear anything. Whe are still trying to figure it out if the video can be listened from a computer. To bad this function is not completed.

Reviews.Title: This is a GREAT Digital Camera!
Reviews.Author: Dr Kaco "Dr Kaco"
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a Cheap priced, good quality product....this is for you.I bought mine 4 weeks ago and loving it!! Makes my old HP photosmart camera seem like a polaroid!

Reviews.Title: Poor quality pics
Reviews.Author: C. Chew "looking for a decent value"
Reviews.Content: the camera has nice features, except the quality of picture.  Indoor pictures taken with the flash are extremely grainy.  Outdoor pictures tend to be out of focus.  Color saturation is poor.  Green's come out a washed out.SteadyShot is turned OFF by default.  That seems strange until I tried using it.  When you use it in brighter conditions, it seems to actually make the pictures worse when the light is bright enough not to need it.  So it seems like you need to actively turn it on/off.  Which, practically speaking, would rarely happen.Overall would not recommend.  The picture quality is too disappointing.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased
Reviews.Author: R.
Reviews.Content: I wanted something cheaper without much frill for fast and easy shots of my friends on vacation.  I was afraid of being overwhelmed with options, or paying for features I was never going to use.  This camera was perfect.  It's very functional and very easy to use. There's a "Smile Shutter" option where the camera will look for people in the frame smiling and automatically take a picture. I thought the pictures would come out blurry, but they're some of my favorites.On the downside, it eats up batteries pretty quick, and I had difficulty importing images.  In the end I uninstalled the disc that came with the camera and just let the computer identify the memory card as a memory stick.IMO this is great for a casual user that still needs decent pictures.

Reviews.Title: battery consumer
Reviews.Author: dhruv
Reviews.Content: This is outstanding at taking photos 12.1 megapixels work great. Its super easy to use and is very stylish, the only downside of this product would be the amount of battery this camera uses. If I take this to a family event, or even just out to take pictures of the city I have to have spare batteries on me all the time, besides that this is a great camera

Reviews.Title: Digital camera
Reviews.Author: Jeff D. Smith
Reviews.Content: Camera came in new condition.  Nice, large LCD screen.  Takes AA batteries, uses AA alkaline batteries fast, but they are very inexpensive to buy and I know I always have fresh batteries on hand (versus wondering if rechargeable battery is going to work).  Manual came with camera.  The camera takes 1-3 seconds after button press to get picture, a bit slow, but picture quality is tops.  Great inexpensive camera for snapshots.  I bought it used for around 50 bucks.  Very satisfied with purchase.

Reviews.Title: Super fast
Reviews.Author: 2legit2quit
Reviews.Content: Received item super fast, and it was exactly what I wanted, takes excellent pictures, I had been looking for a camera a long time.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera.
Reviews.Author: Jones2cg
Reviews.Content: Had an old Cybershot about 4 years ago and was happy with it until it was stolen. Saw this one and thought for the price it was worth a try. Very surprised by the picture quality. No blurriness to the picture even when the target or camera is moving.Obviously not using it for professional photography but for trips and just every day picture taking and printing photos I would highly recommend it especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: very good
Reviews.Author: Jhonattan Paniagua
Reviews.Content: this camera is very good, because the image is excellent, the anti wave is very good, too, the only bad i dont like is the batery, its necesary buy batery, its the only bad.

Reviews.Title: supersony
Reviews.Author: Enrique
Reviews.Content: All technicalities aside, this is an amazing camera, particularly for basic snapshots.  It operates with ease, takes terrific pictures and offers enough features for the casual user to enjoy picture taking under most circumstances.  I enjoy the fact that it uses AA batteries instead of the more expensive and harder-to-find battery packs.  I realize that this camera is a relatively unsophisticated digital, but for the price, it's all one can ask for.

Reviews.Title: perfect
Reviews.Author: kansas
Reviews.Content: i ordered a silver camera for me and then ordered this orange one for a friend thinking she might take my silver one and i could have the orange. wrong she liked the orange one better.  this is a great product and showed up just in time for her birthday

Reviews.Title: Nice for price !!
Reviews.Author: Joseph Girgis
Reviews.Content: For 86.99 I won't get better one,small,attractive new color,easy to use and good quality photos.I got it for my child and we both love it,not a waste of bucks.

Reviews.Title: Sony DSC-2100
Reviews.Author: geo
Reviews.Content: I am really enjoying using this camera. It was a little difficult at first but with patience I finally got it working.Thanks for your assistance

Reviews.Title: Very nice for the price
Reviews.Author: Robert S. Schaefer
Reviews.Content: This camera was a gift for my wife. It is very easy to use and takes nice pictures. This camera is for the non-technical person who just wants a good quality camera that takes very good quality pictures. Simple to use and nice to have.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Conservachick
Reviews.Content: The camera is easy to use. It takes 2 AA batteries to run on. Comes with USB cord. Stores alot of photos and takes clear pictures. The shutter time  takes a bit long, but my pictures turn out just as good as people with the 200$ ones- so I'm happy. It does the job!

Reviews.Title: shuuter problems
Reviews.Author: dcr
Reviews.Content: This is an easy to use camera an my 80 yo mother could use it easily. The picture quality was good for the price. However, after several days of use, the shutter either would not open or opened about 1/4". I changed the batteries and the shutter still did not open. Disappointing as I had a Sony 5mp for 7 years without a problem.

Reviews.Title: Not as good as expected
Reviews.Author: Sherrill A. Smith
Reviews.Content: I've purchased many Sony Cybershot cameras but this was the first that used AA batteries and used the Sony lens and not a Zeiss lens.  It wasn't up to my standards but I gave it to a person who likes it and uses it.  I ordered myself another Sony Cybershot and I love it.

Reviews.Title: Sony DSC-S2100 Digital Camera with Steady Shot Image
Reviews.Author: natalie83
Reviews.Content: I ordered the Sony DSC-S2100 12 IMP Digital Camera with 3X optical Zoom and liked the price with all the great options, but after only using the camera maybe four times, I now have a problems with the camera not working properly. I called Amazon and they kindly told me that they would replace it for me. Gee It was so nice to hear that since with the holiday seasons are right around the corner and the camera is greatly needed.........

Reviews.Title: Cheap Camera but Not the Best Picture Qaulity
Reviews.Author: Ricardo
Reviews.Content: I have had the camera two days. My wife wanted something cheap to replace 35mm film disposable cameras. I wanted a camera that used the same AA batteries as my Sony DSC-W5 and that did not employ a spare battery that costs $30 or more.The picture quality at 12M is inferior to that of my 4 1/2-year old Sony DSC-W5 at 1M. Pictures are not sharp. You can see this in 4x6 prints as well on a monitor. This is for pictures taken in the Intelligent Auto Adjustment mode both in daylight and indoors with the flash set to auto with the SteadyShot on and off. The 4x6 prints are comparable to that from a disposable 35mm film camera.You can set the focus mode in the menus which seems to help for some situations but you loose some of the automatic functions found in the Intelligent mode. Another annoyance is the Face Detection function is turned on each time you power up the camera. However, the lag between shots is minimal and the flash recharges quickly. I fiddled with other brand cameras in a few stores and some of these have considerable lag between shots.The camera consumes battery power fairly quickly. The battery indicator drops to about 1/2 after about 30 shots using rechargeable 2500 mAh NiMH batteries. The rated number of shots in the User Manual is based on using alkaline batteries. The DSC-W5 with new, fully-charged AA NiMH batteries will take several hundred shots.At least Sony has joined the 21st Century and you can now use SD/SDHC and Memory Stick DUO media in the camera.I have not used the Movie Mode so I cannot comment on this function.This camera lists for $110. The DSC-W5 was $350 when it first came out in 2005! You get what you pay for. But now we can go to any big box or drug store and make 4x6 prints for as little as 15 cents each. We can burn our own photo CDs. This is a lot cheaper than buying disposable cameras and having the film processed and the photo quality is comparable for 4x6 prints.

Reviews.Title: So disappointed
Reviews.Author: RANDY ROZEMA
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately for me this camera froze up after the 2nd day of use.  I needed it to be a camera that I could just putin more AA batteries without having to use a charger.  It accomplished that but froze up and I could not get it to takeany other pictures after the 2nd day of use.  It keeps showing a command of "turn the power off and on again".  of whichI have done that multiple times without any success of it becoming able to take more pictures... And the memory discstill has plenty of storage left.......So disappointed.....909 322 5739..If any one cares.....

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera
Reviews.Author: BocaGuySoFLA
Reviews.Content: Easy to use Sony DSC-S2100 has large 3.0 inch screen, nice optical zoom, great battery life. Would recommend to anyone looking for a quality digital camera!

Reviews.Title: quality! user friendly
Reviews.Author: gabe
Reviews.Content: quality! user friendly camera, i like the AA power feature , not to many buttons on camera -it makes it user friendly, you only need to push the button after the initial NEW CAMERA SET UP , and all pics are excellent , oh, and is a SONY

Reviews.Title: Good and simple
Reviews.Author: Patricia_GV
Reviews.Content: The camera is really easy to use for us who like to take pictures of a journey and don't have much photography experience. The downside is that it consumes a lot of battery on automatic mode and it can become really slow after a few shots, but is not a surprise considering it is made for amateurs and tries its best to take beautiful pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great camera - while it worked...
Reviews.Author: MJD
Reviews.Content: This camera was wonderful but at 10 months, the lens just closed down on its own any time we turned it on.  It is useless.  Trying to contact SONY to get them to honor the warranty is not easy.

Reviews.Title: For those lookin' for a Great&Cheap; priced Camera
Reviews.Author: jabroni
Reviews.Content: Who said hand held cameras are fading out??? Not I!! This lil gem is just the thing for those looking for a no non-sense digital camera at a fair price. The images come out great, it runs on 2 AA batteries, video recorder is great and the functions are SIMPLE-User Friendly. As not to drain your batteries when uploading pics/vids to your PC, use a card reader instead of a cable. All in all, great product, great price for a 12mp camera.

Reviews.Title: Defective and Bad Customer Service
Reviews.Author: No more sony cybershot
Reviews.Content: This camera's LCD began to have spots after 6 months after I purchased in Nov 2010.Although I have done nothing wrong (like dropping into the water) for the camera, Sony representatives have refused to repair under the 1 year warranty.They said that it has moisture in the LCD and that is the reason why they cannot fix it for free. How can you make such an absurd assertion when you (Sony) have sold the defective one to a customer?Beware with this camera and expect the poorest warranty protection from Sony.

Reviews.Title: limited but functional
Reviews.Author: shinwolf
Reviews.Content: as it seems to be the few point-and-shoot cams that still run on AA batteries, i initially ordered this to make use of the eneloops from the previous gadgets. at least power replacements are readily available; incase the rechargable batteries die out, just pop in any pair of AAs. there's not much in terms of manual adjustments as it caters to an array of automated settings and megapixel size options. also i haven't figured out how to make the image stabilization work properly... one thing i love is that it can use sd cards and memory stick pro duos. only downside to using sd cards may be the load time per shot is a tad bit slower. over all, it's a satisfying pocketable instacam for its price.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price.
Reviews.Author: Keyman
Reviews.Content: Good for portability. Image quality is not the best, but at less than $100 can't expect much. No rechargeable battery! Batteries drain extremely quick due to the size of the LCD.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: JMiguelRivas
Reviews.Content: I just love it, especially because of the support of sd cards, my older cybershot only have support for M2 cards. The only detail is that doesn't bring a rechargeable battery but well, I have a par of those in my house, so I don't have trouble whit that...

Reviews.Title: sony digital camera
Reviews.Author: Clown teacher "Bubbles"
Reviews.Content: my teenage daughter took this to college with her... she loves this camera... takes great pictures and is very easy to use....  the only thing she wishes it had a rechargeable battery...but the batteries last a long time...... LOVES SONY

Reviews.Title: Nice but not easy to adjust settings
Reviews.Author: MARIO RIBA
Reviews.Content: Very Nice camera, however settings are very complicated, and is not easy to take macro shots, since there is not a direct macro button, nice pictures, another issue is that even if you bring down the resolution of the pictures the photos are very big in size on the computer.

Reviews.Title: ran through batteries in 2 days
Reviews.Author: C. Cannone
Reviews.Content: Takes nice pics, has all the basics but I literally ran through the batteries they gave me in 2 days. I thought all cameras were rechargeable now. It never occurred to me that the camera wasn't rechargeable when I bought it. It's great if you want to buy batteries constantly or bring a few packs of batteries with you on vacation.

Reviews.Title: Blurry Pictures With SteadyShot
Reviews.Author: K. Wilkinson
Reviews.Content: This camera is used to take portrait pictures of people entering the facility where I work. The camera takes blurry photos with the SteadyShot on and only slightly better pictures with that feature turned off. All of the pictures taken with this camera are out of focus.

Reviews.Title: Works as a Camera but dont expect frills!
Reviews.Author: Birdman
Reviews.Content: Decent camera for the price but the images are extremely white. grainy images on the LCD. Great to receive as a gift, not so great to actually PAY for.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Ricardo M.
Reviews.Content: Image quality was surprisingly very BAD. I was surprised, coming from a Sony camera. It was actually worse than my 2 year old Cybershot 7.2 pixels. However video quality was actually good. But since photos are the main purpose of a camera, I had to return it.

Reviews.Title: Fabo Camo!!!
Reviews.Author: Tami
Reviews.Content: I got this camera so I would have something for those "get it now" pics. I'm so happy with this SONY! fits the need AND does so much more. This is the perfect point and shoot camera. Great rear view screen. Easy to use control buttons.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: roberta lange
Reviews.Content: Very good camera purchased it for my mother-in-law who is a camera buff, easy to use and great pictures andshe can plug it into compuetr to share photos

Reviews.Title: Eats batteries daily
Reviews.Author: dianetavegia "Diane"
Reviews.Content: Received this as a present and within months, the camera began to eat through batteries after only a few photos.  I started taking the batteries out after each use, thinking that would help. NOPE.  I changed battery brand. NOPE.  I called Sony and they'd love to repair it (at a charge). NOPE.I do not recommend this camera due to the constant cost to replace batteries.  I'll throw it away.

Reviews.Title: Sony Camera
Reviews.Author: lynette
Reviews.Content: I love this camera only due to the fact I had to purchase it asecond time, the old one broke. I find it so easy to operate andI have fun downloading my photo and sending to friends and family.I felt a little pricey but its worth it..

Reviews.Title: Value for money
Reviews.Author: MiND
Reviews.Content: Bought it in Sept 2011 for ~ $85.Has worked without problems in rain and snow. Only drawback is that the 3x zoom not as good as I needed.Overall a good value for money!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Captain Ghetto
Reviews.Content: I bought it for my mom as a gift. Easy to use especially for her. Good camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Some missing items
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed that the package did not include the memory card, the memory card USB adapter, or the camera to computer cable. Other than these deficiencies, the camera has met my expectations.

Reviews.Title: kinda works
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: Camera works OK, however, when first turned on ,and the lens extends,the lens cover will not open unless the lens is "tapped".  Seems to work ok after that until it is powered off, then when turn ON the lens cover again sticks.

Reviews.Title: Not a durable screen/ camera
Reviews.Author: LovinLife
Reviews.Content: I bought this digital camera because it was orange and it was cheap.PROS: color (orange), easy to use, takes actual batteries not a battery pack, great outdoor picturesCONS: picture quality isn't very good in low lighting, you cant move the camera at all without the pictures coming out blurry, it takes a while to load the pictures to view them, kind of a thick design, *not very durable screen*- The screens on these cameras are very cheap. The camera I had had a screen protector and I always put it in a case. But, the one time I threw it in my purse without a case on the screen broke! The same thing happened to a friend of mine with the same camera in silver. I do not recommend this camera at all. There are plenty of other cameras that are about the same price that hold up much better.

Reviews.Title: i love it
Reviews.Author: Charles Shafer Jr
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter to replace one she had damaged the screen on. She loves it .

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: HerMighty
Reviews.Content: Very Satisfied with this camera.  It takes good pictures, even though I tend to have a shaky hand.  I can take short videos and switching the pics and videos from the camera onto my computer is very easy.

Reviews.Title: great buy
Reviews.Author: F. Dale Cauthen "ppcgm"
Reviews.Content: Good value for the price and all around a great little camera. It's serving me well and looks like it will hold up to a lot of use. Definitely do buy a big memory chip for it though. The internal memory is about enough for one photo.

Reviews.Title: Does a good job
Reviews.Author: moon goddess
Reviews.Content: I'm an amateur, so I can't speak to advanced settings -- though, I was able to figure out how to take photos of the full moon from my roof one night. I like that it takes regular AA batteries and, for simple photos, it is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Digital camera
Reviews.Author: PW
Reviews.Content: I bought this used camera as a gift for my 8 year old grandson as his first camera.  It was in perfect condition.  A great bargain for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great camera at a Great Price.
Reviews.Author: Rosemary Galpin
Reviews.Content: Has all the bells and whistles that my father-in-law needed. He loves it and uses it all the time. I would definitely recommend it for all age groups.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera, just not dog proof!
Reviews.Author: Ben
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my girlfriend as a gift. Great picture quality, easy to use. Nice easy to see screen. Unfortunately, the camera is not dog proof, as we found out when her dog decided to have it as a snack! The dog attack does not affect the score I gave it though :). It's worth the price, not an exceptional camera, but not lacking anywhere either.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Mitchell Rozonkiewiecz
Reviews.Content: It is a simple camera to use and takes good picturesque and videos.I am happy with the camera and so is my wife.We received it, and used it the same day.

Reviews.Title: not good
Reviews.Author: Jaime
Reviews.Content: i do not like it, the image is not good and you waast a lot of bateries. wast of money.not good at all.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful item good deal
Reviews.Author: Ramon Enrique Berliza Yorro
Reviews.Content: This stuff work really great and it is very easy to use. it came with all accessories only one thing, seller told that it included a battery charger andi did not find it in the box.Any way it was a good dealThank Amazon and Game 4 less.

Reviews.Title: sony camera
Reviews.Author: allan
Reviews.Content: This is a replacement for the one that was dropped.Sony is a very good product.Great price!

Reviews.Title: product defective after 3rd use.
Reviews.Author: buyer111
Reviews.Content: Shutter wouldn't close anymore after 3rd use. So couldn't take camera anywhere to prevent lens from getting scratched/damaged.

Reviews.Title: disappointed
Reviews.Author: nopenname
Reviews.Content: I got this camera as a gift without a gift receipt.  I really don't like it.  I am not a professional photographer, but I can take pictures pretty well.  It doesn't show on this camera.  Pictures are blurry, grainy, and just purely awful.  I'm so disappointed.  It also doesn't come with a memory card, which is costly separately, especially after buying a camera already!  The batteries make it heavy, and the camera itself is fat because there are huge batteries in it!  I wish the person who bought me this read all the reviews.  I've read them on many sites, and it's not good.  If you really want a TOTALLY BASIC camera, and you haven't had a good camera before, this is good.  If you have had a good camera before, this will really disappoint you.  Please think before buying.  Save your money and buy a better one.  IT IS NOT WORTH IT!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Disappointment
Reviews.Author: Leslie Solorzano
Reviews.Content: I thought this camera was 12 mp my old sony of 4mp takes better pictures, all of them are blurry no matter what the options are. The flash seems to be too bright and all the pictures with flash look high contrast, it doesnt have good focus and it is not good for landscapes, the resolution is terrible, it is 4000x3000 of blurry pixels.

Reviews.Title: missing accesories
Reviews.Author: Alan M. Kaufman
Reviews.Content: nice camera but requires purchase of a card to store pictures and a card reader to download pictures

Reviews.Title: Doesn't take rechargeable batteries.
Reviews.Author: B. Matuza
Reviews.Content: The camera is ok, but I get blurry shots for no reason sometimes and the fact that it doesn't take rechargeable batteries is a disappointment. I had no idea when I bought this that it didn't have or accept rechargeable batteries.

Reviews.Title: NOT A COMPLETE ITEM.
Reviews.Author: Marcial Cordova
Reviews.Content: This item does not include memory or a carring case.So the value is not so good.

ProductInfo.Features:
12.1-megapixel resolution, 3x zoom lens, 3.0-inch LCD screen (230K pixels)
Convenient AA battery operation and memory card slot for convenient replacement
Easy Shooting Mode simplifies camera operation; SteadyShot image stabilization helps prevent blur
iAuto automatically optimizes camera settings
Card slot for optional Memory Stick Duo media and SD media
ProductInfo.Name: Sony DSC-S2100 12.1MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom with Digital Steady Shot Image Stabilization and 3.0 inch LCD (Silver)
